page.title: 01MID-WORCESTERSHIRE
page.content: The area of this block is pre- dominantly agricultural.Recently it was noteable for its orchards and fruit production but it is now an area of mixed farming. The soil,being river deposits,is mainly rich but heavy clay.A large range of cereals and vegetables are grown and livestock are kept;beef and milking cattle,sheep and pigs being dominant. The land undulates gently,nowhere being unavailable for agricultural development.Large areas of woodland are left standing and though some of these are managed for timber many are left for shooting and hunting. Worcester is the dominant urban focus, many local people go there shopping, for entertainment and for schools. It is a very quiet rural backwater with a sparse population.
